intro: Gochnatia pauciflosculosa, commonly known as the sparse-flowered gochnatia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in arid conditions. The flowers are small and inconspicuous, often arranged in clusters, and are visited by various pollinators.
